system.appearance: Usually bulky and covered in heavy, bony plates.

results.hit: Target is dead, ruined, and their SIZE is reduced by 1. If their SIZE was already less than 1, it is reduced to 0.

overview.base: You gain Improved Strength and Melee Damage Boost. In addition, you are no longer suffer the consequences of cumbersome items.
You gain Beastly Strength and Improved Armor Piercing.

Can wield two-handed weapons in one hand.
Note: AP weapons must still be wielded in two hands to be AV0.
Melee weapons you use are armor piercing.
You may spend an unused action to boost the triggering damage.
overview.proficient: You may spend an additional unused action to boost the triggering damage again.

system.trigger: You have hit a creature with a damaging melee weapon attack.

overview.base: You gain Offensive Martial Arts and Defensive Martial Arts.

Your hands count as weapons for the purposes of abilities that target or are delivered by (although they cannot be shattered or destroyed). You may attack with them and their damage die is now [[/damage 1d4]].
overview.proficient: The damage die is instead [[/damage 1d6]].
overview.fluent: The damage die is instead [[/damage 1d8]].

overview.base:
Your hands count as shields for the purposes of abilities that target them (although they cannot be shattered or destroyed). You may block with them and their BV is +1.
Note: This does not make your hands blocking.
You always have at least 3 AV. This is the case even when you are not wearing armor.
You can see in the dark up to 60 feet.
You cannot use items in your hands.

You may block with a BV equal to your AV for the purpose of Shattering Armor.
Note: This does not allow you to delivery other blocks in this way.

results.save: Equipment that delivers attack you block becomes shattered.

overview.base: You gain Bite and become fluent in it. Additionally, your mouth is AV0.

Your mouth counts as a weapon for the purposes of abilities that target or are delivered by it (although it cannot be shattered or destroyed). You may attack with it and its damage die is now [[/damage 1d4]].
overview.proficient: The damage die is instead [[/damage 1d6]].
overview.fluent: The damage die is instead [[/damage 1d8]].
